title: Refined universality of the turbulence cascade
authors: F. Schmitt, A. Fuchs, J. Peinke, M. Obligado
abstract:
Using a very large dataset of turbulent wakes, which includes different
generators and inflows, we explore the relationship between two fundamental
quantities of turbulent flows: the dissipation constant $C_\varepsilon$ and the
intermittency factor $\mu$. For the energy cascade, $C_\varepsilon$ is known to
reflect its basic overall properties, while $\mu$ quantifies the emerging
intermittency down the cascade. We find that these quantities are related, as
$\mu$ is inversely proportional to $C_\varepsilon$, providing a new principle
that also applies to inhomogeneous flows.
